newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: MERITA TO ENTER CUSTODIAN MARKET.
newsitem.headline: MERITA TO ENTER CUSTODIAN MARKET.

text.p: Finland's Merita Bank Ltd. is going to enter the custodian market in Lithuania and is also interested in issuing its own bonds in litas, the company said.
"We are going to enter the custodian market here," Merita Bank Vice President Raimo Valo told Reuters at a conference on Lithuanian capital markets and investment opportunities.
"It's just a matter of time. It's very close...but we have to do a little bit of paperwork," he said.
Valo said Merita's bonds would add more instruments to the country's debt market.
"This market needs more instruments and one way to get more instruments is to issue our own bonds, Merita Bank's own bonds," said Valo. "We have done it in Latvia and Estonia."
"Basically, all investors want to have a hedge for a long term in the currency where they have the cash flow," Valo said.
Valo said it would be issuing the bonds for Finnish and international clients, at least at first.

"Finnish and international clients first and foremost," Valo said. "Of course when the market has developed better, then there will probably be other issues and of course the market will widen quickly.
